key_points: Twitter locked the Chinese Embassy in the U.S. Twitter account for violating its dehumanization policy.
The contested tweet claimed Uighur women were no longer 'baby making machines,' referring to a state-backed newspaper study.
Twitter requires violation tweets to be manually deleted by account owners, but the embassy hasn't posted since Jan. 9.
Mike Pompeo declared China's actions in Xinjiang as 'genocide' in one of his final acts as Secretary of State.
Antony Blinken, President Joe Biden's Secretary of State, shares Pompeo's view on China's policies in Xinjiang.
China sanctioned Pompeo and 27 other Trump administration officials, barring them and their families from entering China.
At least one million Uighurs and other Muslims have been reportedly detained in camps in Xinjiang, according to a UN panel.
German researcher Adrian Zenz accused China of using forced sterilization and abortion against Uighurs, which China denies.
Canada's House of Commons subcommittee concluded the treatment of Uighurs in Xinjiang amounts to genocide, which China refuted.
The suspension of the Chinese Embassy's Twitter account followed the removal of Donald Trump's account due to the risk of violence.
spokespersons: Antony Blinken (President Joe Biden's Secretary of State)
